bibl.title: Joseph Deveriske v. Territory of Washington. Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington

body.p: In the District Court of the Fourth Judicial District, Spokane County, Territory of Washington. Habeas Corpus} In the matter of the } Petition application of John Joseph Deveriske for said writ.

To the Hon. L.B. Nash, Judge of said Court Your petitioner respectfully represents: I. That one John Joseph Deveriske is defraud of illegaly and by pretense reclaimed of his liberty by Joseph Warren, Chief of Police of the City of Spokane Falls in the calaboose and prison of said City.

II. That the cause and pretense of said restraint is an order and sentence made by J.R. Snyder, Justice of the Peace of said County is said Joseph Warren to imprison said John Joseph Deveriske for the crime of larceny as forth in section 833 of the code of Washington,

III. That said imprisonment was and is illegal in this, that said Justices Court had no jurisdiction to make each order and sentence. Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may issue that said John Joseph Deveriske may be brought before
this Honorable Court, and the cause of said imprisonment and restraint enquired That if said imprisonment be without foundation and illegal said John Joseph Deveriske may be discharged.
County of Spokane } SS Territory of Washington

Batty Deverisky being duly sworn deposes says that she is the petitioner in the above entittled cause, that she has read the foregoing petition and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true as she believes Subscribed and sworn to by on this this 16th day of April. A.D. 1888
Batty Deveriske X her mark Witness to her signature mark W.F. White
William F. White Noraty Public for Washington Territory
In the Dist. Court Spokane County Territory of Washington.
People vs. John Deveriske Habeas Corpus
Filed April 19, 1888 D.A. Clement Clerk By Chaz B. Johnston
Lidell Baker Atty for petitioner Deputy
